So,
after reading this thread I got something like:
Zeronet is crap, NSA catches you and the project itself is dead.
Freenet is an hdd/sdd filler, mostly in porn. So not only NSA catches you, but you even don't know why. 
IPFS has nothing to do with this, but you can decentralize and pin your legit files. All can see each others' ip and stuff, but who cares.
TOR: NSA control entry nodes, so they catch you.
VPN: they log even if they say they don't, and give all to NSA. They catch you.
CARRIER PIGEONS: usefull, but not during hunting season.

So, what do we do? Get back to clearnet?

> [ranshit](#comment_133_17XPGJDqy3F7zfV3sa4aMJF2Mhpati6N12): Why would the NSA hunt for you? Being another idiot on the internet is not unlawful.

I did not say "catch me". I did say "catch you"
